data.title: Cannot turn off wordwrap
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:33:15.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: none
---

Despite careful perusal of the settings (including the "Toggle Words Wrap" menu option), lines continue to wrap on screen.  This issue seems oddly intermittent --, sometimes when I load up the editor, word wrap is OFF, but after switching tabs, it turns ON.

Specifically, this issue affects PHP files I am editing.  Other files don't seem to have this issue (JS,HTML, CSS...).


Steps to Reproduce:

1. modify settings to turn off word wrap
2. frustration

data.title: Add option to always reuse open editors
data.body:
The idea being that we never* open the same file in more than one editor at a time, regardless of the action which opens the editor.

*never meaning whenever possible, for example splitting with a single file open or explicitly opening the same file "side by side" cannot work if we literally take the newly introduced option.
Implements #7049 (note that the issue's title talks only about Ctrl/Cmd+P action but the consensus - at least with @bpasero and the issue creator - seems to be that we should apply the logic to all "open a document" actions).

data.title: 3-1-17 source build: Extension Viewlet  cannot search, install any extensions (NO Proxy)
data.body:
Development Environment:

OS: Windows 7 Professional SP1 (VM under OSX)
Python: ActiveState 2.7.5

VS Code: 1.10.1 master release
Visual Studio 15 Community \ C++ Tools \ SDK 8.1
VS Code: 1.10.1 (Code OSS Build environment)
VS Code Insiders 1.10.0 2-27 build: (Test environment)
VS Code: master clone 2-28 and 3-1  date tests

Node: 6.9.1
NPM:  3.10.8

Description Of Bug:

VCS does not search, download, install any extensions
with the extension wiget. Entering anything in the search bar
results in no extensions found.

If I manually copy an extension from the extension directory
of VC code to the extension directory of .vscode-oss these
extensions will show up , activate and function. Besides
vscode-icons I also copied ftp-sync to test a network extension
this succeeded without problems. Still no ability to search download marketplace

I have no proxy, working from home.  Looking at other posted issues
they seem similar but without the proxy involved.
Other VSC release downloads have no similar problems with multiple
Code release versions.

Inspecting the developer tools console output shows no errors.
I have not gotten debugging of vscode  yet, so I have not
been able to inspect and debug the code directly yet
(anxious to do so).


Steps to reproduce:

git clone https://github.com/microsoft/vscode
.\scripts\npm install
.\scripts\code
(successful build - launches Code OSS Dev)
View extensions
(enter any search for an extension - no results)

A successful package exhibits the same bug
.\node_modules\.bin\gulp vscode-win32

manually copied extensions appear in the widget
and function (except for an update attempt)

Cheers Christopher

data.title: Touch support can be improved in webviews
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insider 1.11.0
- OS Version: Windows 10, Build 15046
- Machine: Surface Pro 3, with latest drivers

There are several places where touch support needs improvement:

1. In extension description pages, scrolling by touch does not work. 
2. In markdown preview, scrolling by touch does not work
3. When there is a split view, or when I just closed a tab, there is a possibility where tapping the tabs does not work. This is not reproducible every time. 

Touch is an essential functionality in many senarios. I often find it easier to scroll through webpages (like markdown previews) by touch than using the trackpad. There are also times people might use VS Code without a trackpad or mouse. It would be great help if touch support can be improved.

data.title: Apostrophe breaks syntax highlighting for Ini files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:27:09.350Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.9|
|vim|vscodevim|0.5.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an ini file where a text value contains an apostrophe in the middle, e.g.:

```
[Sample]
SomeKey=Someone's Value
SomeOtherKey=42
```

2. Note that from the apostrophe onward, the rest of the file is considered a string.

Different ini implementations have their own interpretations of values. E.g., Windows does not consider the apostrophes of a quoted value part of that value. I'm not aware of the exact rules, but at least the current highlighting behavior is wrong. I think it would be better to stick to the universally valid rules – sections, keys and values – and not to consider apostrophes special at all.

data.title: Starting debugger updates the file in current active tab
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

When starting the debugger, the currently opened file (inside the active tab in VScode), is updated. 
Problem : when run with tool like nodemon and grunt watch, this restarts node, and then stops the debugger.
This issue is since last update (1.10.1) of VsCode, was not like that before.

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Mac Os 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have nodemon and grunt watch running 
2. Open any js file
3. Start debugger with config : 
```
 {
            "name": "Attach",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "port": 5857,
            "address": "localhost",
            "restart": false,
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "outDir": null,
            "localRoot": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "remoteRoot": null
        },
```
==> the currently opened tab is updated, just after clicking on debugger start. eg : nodemon output

```
>> File "schemas/customerSchema.ts" changed.
Running "ts:node" (ts) task
Compiling...
Using tsc v2.1.6
```

Result : impossible to debug, because updating a source file launch through grunt watch typescript compiler (it is what we want, indeed). Compiler then force node to restart, and then debugger is stopped...back to the beginning......

data.title: Feature request: Some way to increase list of recently opened folders

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS (also tested on Windows)

Steps to reproduce:

1. View welcome screen.
2. Only 5 items listed under "Recent." No apparent way to increase the length of this list.

Or:

1. File -> Open Recent
2. Only 10 items listed. No apparent way to increase the length of this list. [Changing the system-wide default does not seem to work on macOS.](http://osxdaily.com/2013/12/02/change-number-files-open-recent-menu-mac-os-x/)

Note: this is sort of confusing since in [the source code appears to set the maximum to 100](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/799198928b772d1def661d3cd7962f04b7f38b98/src/vs/code/electron-main/windows.ts#L131).

data.title: Needs ability to provide "user css"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.0
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

PR #14237 added a style that I have been eagerly waiting for. However, now that it has been released, it's still unusable for me. I have a theme installed that I like except for the styling around the cursor (`.monaco-editor .cursors-layer.cursor-block-outline-style > .cursor`). So the reasonable assumption would be that I can override that style with my own styling. But that isn't the case; vscode doesn't provide any way to specify user styles., e.g. in Atom select "Stylesheet..." from the Atom menu.

data.title: Provide JavaScript TM scope for exported function names in Node modules
data.body:
There is currently no JavaScript TM scope which can identify function names when they are specified as part of a Node module export. This makes it impossible to have a consistent styling for function names where functions are defined.

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional, Version 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a JavaScript file with the content `module.exports.square = function(x) { return x * x; };` or `exports.square = function(x) { return x * x; };`.
2. Use the builtin TM scopes inspector to view scopes for `square`. Available scopes are `entity.name.function.js` and `source.js`. Both of these are used in many other places.
3. Compare to scopes available for `square` in `function square(x) { return x * x; }`. This time the scope `meta.definition.function.js` is available which can be used to style function names where they are defined. This styling is not possible when the function name is only given as part of a Node module export.

data.title: UX: Settings Minimap viewport size change
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.10.1 - OS Version: MacOS 10.12.1 Minuscule minimap mishap. ~~~Viewport size expands upon reaching end of settings file. I'm unsure what other aspects of the situation I'm missing or if it's only applicable for the settings file.~~~ ~~~Aspects that have no baring~~~ ~~~- groups~~~ ~~~- collapse state of setting sections~~~ Steps to 1. Open settings 2. Collapse / Uncollapse sections 3. Look at minimap viewport 2. ~~~Scroll to bottom of default settings~~~ 3. ~~~Scroll up enough so that the last section is not 100% still in view~~~ 4. ~~~Hover over minimap to display the viewport indicator, then repeat steps 3 & 4 at your leisure.~~~ The way the minimap handles the settings collapsed sections differently then that of 'code' collapsed sections and the inconsistency made it seem like it was a *bug* but its probably *working as design*. I don't know how the settings are structured in the backend but I presume that it is an aggregate view and the minimap viewport size is generated per source. As the source from 'code' is singular (example, user settings file), the size is singular. Since the settings are an aggregate and can take up a varying amount of space (due to collapsed state). I think that for a consistent user experience, the minimap viewport size should stay the same. So the collapsed state shouldn't have any baring on that size. Relevant labels: UX, settings, editor-minimap

data.title: Monokai Dimmed theme does not show diff highlight
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.10.1 - OS Version: macOS Sierra, Windows 10 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install VS Code 1. Open new file 1. Paste: ```diff --- index.html +++ index.html @@ -0, +1,1 @@ - old + new unchanged ``` 1. Set language to "Diff" 1. Set Monokai Dimmed theme ## Expected behavior `old` and `new` should be highlighted, but aren't: Compare this to e.g. Monokai:
